As a journalist, you can create a free Muck Rack account to customize your profile, list your contact preferences, and upload a portfolio of your best work. Claim your profile Articles Lady Gaga Confirms Continuation of 'Telephone' in New Interview Feb 22, 2025 | By Ally Nakamura | Glitter Magazine Verified In a new lie detector test interview with Vanity Fair, Lady Gaga reveals that her “Telephone” music video will be continued. When asked if Beyoncé will be joining her, Gaga replies with a hopeful “maybe.”In 2010, Gaga and Beyoncé released the iconic song “Telephone” with an accompanying 10-minute music video. In the video, Beyoncé breaks Gaga out of prison and they drive away in a red and yellow truck. Open in Who Shared Issue with article? This byline is for a different person with the same name. This byline is mine, but I want my name removed. Inaccurate duplicate grouping of articles. Other byline problem Multiple byline problems on this page 'TIME' Announces New Women of the Year Honorees Feb 21, 2025 | By Ally Nakamura | Glitter Magazine Verified TIME Magazine unveiled its Women of the Year list and Nicole Kidman, Jordan Chiles, and Laufey are all on it. According to TIME, their Women of the Year list highlights women who are all “in their own way, working toward creating a better, more equitable world.” The publication explains, “When we sit down to think about the Women of the Year each winter, we ask ourselves the same question: What are the most significant issues facing women and girls around the world right now? Open in Who Shared Issue with article? This byline is for a different person with the same name. This byline is mine, but I want my name removed. Inaccurate duplicate grouping of articles. Other byline problem Multiple byline problems on this page A Look Into The Lumineers’ New Album 'Automatic' Feb 20, 2025 | By Ally Nakamura | Glitter Magazine Verified The Lumineers released their new album Automatic on February 14. This follows the release of their single “Same Old Song.” Automatic features 11 songs, running a total of 32 minutes, featuring “Same Old Song,” “A**hole,” “Strings,” “Automatic,” “You’re All I Got,” “Plasticine,” “Ativan,” “Keys on the Table,” “Better Day,” “Sunflowers,” and “So Long.” The album aligns with the band’s genre of music, alternative folk and indie.
